definition: to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale

sentences.english: Usted and ustedes are respectful and formal words used to express you , in the singular and plural forms.
sentences.chinese: 您和您們是正式和尊敬的稱呼，有單數和複數之分。

sentences.english: The safest form is to nod and give a verbal salutation.
sentences.chinese: 最安全的方式就是點頭，並給予口頭稱呼。

sentences.english: If may, I want to call you for the fine jade fine jade.
sentences.chinese: 如果可以的話，我想稱呼你爲璐璐。

sentences.english: Later, people in charge of the sky with stars Ma Bole to call him names.
sentences.chinese: 後來人們就用天上掌馬星伯樂的名字來稱呼他。

sentences.english: You ever hear white people callin' each other "honky" all the time?
sentences.chinese: 你什麼時候聽過白人互相稱呼“白鬼”嗎，兄弟？
在提摩太後書1章7節那裏，保羅這樣稱呼它。

sentences.english: The letter bears the salutation “Dear Sir”。
sentences.chinese: 信上寫有稱呼語“親愛的先生”。

sentences.english: You can see the inner ring, have called each other inside the office of the Chinese?
sentences.chinese: 你看內環之內，有沒有寫字樓裏面互相稱呼中文名的？

sentences.english: Soap General term for the "salt" of a fatty acid.
sentences.chinese: 皁基對脂肪酸鹽的一般性稱呼。

sentences.english: I'll say that one more time.
No. That’s how people refer to little girls.
sentences.chinese: 不，那是對小女孩的稱呼。

sentences.english: Luan: It's not a very nice term, but yes, it's true.
sentences.chinese: 這樣稱呼並不太好聽，但是，確實如此。

sentences.english: Please call me Lois. First names are more friendly than last names.
sentences.chinese: 請叫我伊洛絲吧，稱呼名子比稱呼姓要更親切一些。

sentences.english: Please call me Lois. First names are more friendly than last names.
sentences.chinese: 請叫我伊洛絲吧，稱呼名子比稱呼姓要更親切一些。

sentences.english: Why do you call me, 'Lord, Lord,' and do not do what I say?
sentences.chinese: 你們爲什麼稱呼我‘主啊，主啊’卻不遵我的話行呢？

sentences.english: You ever hear white people callin' each other "honky" all the time?
sentences.chinese: 你什麼時候聽過白人互相稱呼“白鬼”嗎，兄弟？

definition: to call oneself/to claim to be/to profess/to claim a title
one's conduct/deed/activity/accomplishment/achievement/to act as/as (in the capacity of)/qua/to view as/to look upon (sth as)/to take sth to be
word (general term including monosyllables through to short phrases)/term (e.g. technical term)/expression
to know/to recognize/to be familiar with/to get acquainted with sb/knowledge/understanding/awareness/cognition
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke
only/merely/nothing but/no more than/it's just that ...
